basics.name: Jasmine 'Jazz' Sanders
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a Web Developer Certificate at Sullivan University. I expect to graduate in March, 2026.

courses: A technical deep-dive into the architecture of the modern web. This program focused on full-stack fundamentals, responsive design, and the coding languages necessary to build functional, user-centric digital experiences.

An intensive study of the mechanics of dispute resolution. Developed professional-grade skills in mediation, negotiation, and restorative justice practices designed to foster collaborative environments in professional settings.

education.area: Master of Business Administration with a Concentration in Conflict Management (Summa Cum Laude)
courses: Advanced business training focused on the intersection of executive leadership and human-centric solutions. This program paired core business strategy and organizational behavior with the specialized ability to navigate and resolve high-stakes corporate disputes.

education.area: Aviation with a Concentraiton in Aerospace Management (Magna Cum Laude)
courses: Comprehensive training in the operational and logistical side of the aviation industry. Curriculum highlights included airport management, aviation safety standards, and the strategic oversight of complex aerospace systems.

A degree focused on linguistic mastery and the rich cultural tapestry of the Spanish-speaking world. Beyond language proficiency, the program emphasized historical and social cultural studies, further enriched by a semester of full immersion via a study abroad program in Granada, Spain.

work.summary: Head of the Main Campus Store and Inclusive Access Program for Sullivan University
highlights: Align store services with institutional goals, viewing operational systems as foundational to student persistence
Translate departmental insights into campus-wide improvements through cross-departmental coordination
Manage budgets and resources with a focus on long-term institutional value and operational excellence
Led the implementation of the Inclusive Access program, ensuring 100% day-one readiness for students through electronic and physical material distribution
Authored and executed standardized policies for textbook access, reducing technical friction and academic barriers
Served as a technical point of contact for faculty and staff to resolve hurdles impacting student performance

work.summary: Manager of daily, high-volume operations through empathetic leadership and active mediation
highlights: Managed daily operations and lead a cross-functional team with an emphasis on empathy and clarity
Served as primary mediator for personnel and customer disputes, utilizing specialized communication techniques

awards.title: President's Recognition of Excellence
awards.awarder: Dr. Swenson, President of Sullivan University
awards.summary: A prestigious distinction presented by the University President to individuals who demonstrate exceptional leadership and dedication to the institution. This honor, symbolized by a commemorative President’s Coin, recognizes significant contributions to the university’s mission, operational excellence, and the enrichment of the student experience.
